text: not being able to pop your ears on a
flight is an excruciating experience and
over the last couple of months I've had
to deal with it more times than I've
wanted to I've had sinus infections the
last two flights that I've taken and
yeah talk about impeccable timing if you
do have a bad sinus infection and you
have a flight coming up doctors will
recommend that you either cancel your
flight or change your flight but let's
be real that's probably not going to
happen for most of us so I have come up
with these techniques that I personally
tried especially over the last couple
months that have helped me quite a lot
when dealing with a bad sinus infection
well flying at number eight take an
over-the-counter decongestant about 20
minutes before you ascend or descend
take a decongestant and this will help
to open up your sinuses and alleviate
the pain at number seven always pack gum
with you on every flight not only will
gum keep your breath nice and
deliciously deliciously smelling
delicious smelling but it will also help
to the chomping will also help to pop
your ears if you do not have gum you can
always use candy or anything that you
can suck on they'll produce saliva so
that you can constantly swallow which
will also help to pop your ears
number six sip on some water if you
don't have gum or candy you can always
sip on water every time you swallow you
have another chance of hopefully pop in
those ears and also doing it in a
non-intrusive in gentle way at number
five yawn blow swallow sounds extremely
sexual my fake yawning blowing your nose
or swallowing constantly this will also
hopefully help you pop those ears but
when you are blowing your nose just try
not to do it too hard because this can
rupture your eardrum and cause even more
discomfort at number four use a neti pot
I have been
using a neti pot for eight years and I
would recommend if you have never if you
don't use it on a day-to-day basis which
I do but if you don't use a noun a
teapot about a week before you're about
to take your flight if you do not know
what a neti pot is it's a container that
is used to clean out the debris or the
mucus in your nasal passage and it's
been used for centuries number three
don't sleep during takeoff or landing if
you're asleep during takeoff or landing
then you will not be able to equalize
and this could cause pressure buildup in
your sinuses so I would recommend
setting an alarm where when you're about
to ascend and you can also ask a flight
attendant to wake you up about ten
minutes or so before you land at number
two hold a cup of napkins soaked in hot
water up to your ears yes you will look
absolutely ridiculous but this is one of
my favorite techniques it is so soothing
and it really does help so you can also
find attendant to give you two paper
cups filled with napkins that have been
dipped in boiling water and all you
going to do is hold them up to your ears
and just keep them there until you land
and last but not least number one do not
stress I remember all of the times that
I've dealt with pressure buildup in my
ears and it's absolutely horrible
it's a horrible experience especially
when you land and still for hours and
sometimes days your ears feel like you
have a bunch of cotton balls stuck in
them you just like you can't hear proper
it properly and there's just so much
pressure can cause a headache and it's
just sucks it sucks although it can be
really scary and may even feel like your
ears will never be the same again they
will be just remain calm and eventually
your ears will pop and it will be
orgasmic but having said that if your
ears do not pop after 24 hours of
landing I would recommend going to see a
doctor the last time that I dealt with
this awful year situation I was so
worried I take worried to the max
sometimes and I was like I'm going to be
deaf I'm never gonna hear the same again
but I can hear I can hear very well my
ears pops it felt amazing and yours well
too
now I want to know have any of you dealt
with your ears not popping on a flight
share your story below and I cannot wait
to read all the comments and I will see
you next time happy travels
wait before you go anywhere don't forget
to subscribe so you never miss out on
any upcoming adventures happy travels
